title: How to Make a Serve Yourself Ice Cream Parlor for Dessert

steps.headline: Clear a space where everyone can access the items easily.
steps.description: A kitchen bench-top or table are ideal places.

steps.headline: Arrange the toppings.
steps.description:
These are best placed in a row so that everyone can choose their favorites as they walk along. Good choices include:
M&Ms, Smarties, candy covered chocolate button style candies
Rainbow sprinkles/100s and 1000s
Chocolate dots/drops/pieces
Flake bars
Jelly beans or other jelly candies
Chocolate sprinkles
Cocoa powder/chocolate powder.

steps.headline: Slice up fruit.
steps.description: Slice bananas and strawberries. Place into separate bowls for serving. If you are leaving the bananas out for a time, it's a good idea to sprinkle with lemon juice, to prevent browning.

steps.headline: Add a bowl of whole berries to the line-up.
steps.description: For example, blueberries, raspberries and loganberries.

steps.headline: Warm up chocolate and caramel syrups.
steps.description: Pour into separate jugs or bowls, to allow for easy addition.

steps.headline: Place out a bowl or can of whipped cream.
steps.description: Add a spoon if it helps with serving.

steps.headline: Put out bowls, scoops, spoons.
steps.description: Include aprons if you're worried about a mess, and definitely have napkins (serviettes). If using cones as well as––or in place of––bowls, place these out on the table too.

steps.headline: Put out the ice cream at the last moment.
steps.description: Include scoops for ease of obtaining. If there is a break between second helpings, consider returning it to the freezer in between servings to stop it from melting.

steps.headline: Ask everyone to line up and make their own sundae.
steps.description: A fun variant can be to have kids or teens as the servers who prepare what everyone else asks for, as well as their own sundaes.

text:
Clear a space where everyone can access the items easily. A kitchen bench-top or table are ideal places. Arrange the toppings. These are best placed in a row so that everyone can choose their favorites as they walk along. Good choices include:
M&Ms, Smarties, candy covered chocolate button style candies
Rainbow sprinkles/100s and 1000s
Chocolate dots/drops/pieces
Flake bars
Jelly beans or other jelly candies
Chocolate sprinkles
Cocoa powder/chocolate powder. Slice up fruit. Slice bananas and strawberries. Place into separate bowls for serving. If you are leaving the bananas out for a time, it's a good idea to sprinkle with lemon juice, to prevent browning. Add a bowl of whole berries to the line-up. For example, blueberries, raspberries and loganberries. Warm up chocolate and caramel syrups. Pour into separate jugs or bowls, to allow for easy addition. Place out a bowl or can of whipped cream. Add a spoon if it helps with serving. Put out bowls, scoops, spoons. Include aprons if you're worried about a mess, and definitely have napkins (serviettes). If using cones as well as––or in place of––bowls, place these out on the table too. Put out the ice cream at the last moment. Include scoops for ease of obtaining. If there is a break between second helpings, consider returning it to the freezer in between servings to stop it from melting. Ask everyone to line up and make their own sundae. A fun variant can be to have kids or teens as the servers who prepare what everyone else asks for, as well as their own sundaes. Finished.
